meanings.meaning: period when a parliament, etc. does not meet

examples: Parliament is taking the Christmas recess a little early this year.
The decision cannot be made while the council is in recess.

meanings.meaning: part of a wall, set back from the rest of the wall

examples: to fit a blind inside a window recess

meanings.meaning: (usually recesses) part furthest from the light

examples: He stared into the dark recesses of the room.
(figurative) fears lurking deep in the recesses of our minds
(figurative) I had continually pushed my doubts to the darker recesses of my mind.
The statue was in the inner recesses of the temple.
